Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: To analyze the bias in the two event logs for the hiring process, we need to compare the processes and outcomes for candidates in Group A (Protected Group) and Group B (Unprotected Group).

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Summarizing candidates in Group A: P001 with scores 85,70,65 no adjustment hired; P002 78,75,60 no adjustment not hired; P003 82,68,65 no adjustment hired.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Summarizing candidates in Group B: U001 80,72,60+5=65 adjustment hired; U002 78,70,60 no adjustment not hired; U003 75,65,58+5=63 adjustment hired.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The main difference between the two groups is that candidates in Group B who belong to the LocalBusinessLeadersClub receive a +5 score adjustment on their CulturalFit score.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: This Association Boost is only given to candidates in Group B who are part of the LocalBusinessLeadersClub.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Comparing U001 vs P002: U001 original total 212 boosted to 217 hired; P002 213 not hired, suggesting boost influences decision.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Comparing U003 vs P002: U003 original 198 boosted to 203 hired; P002 213 not hired, showing lower qualified with boost still hired.

Name: Ethical or Moral Reasoning - PE
Text: The bias manifests through a +5 boost on the CulturalFit score for candidates who are part of the LocalBusinessLeadersClub in Group B, providing preferential treatment.

Name: Ethical or Moral Reasoning - PE
Text: This bias could lead to candidates from Group B being favored over Group A simply because they are part of a specific local association, making the process unfair.

Name: Ethical or Moral Reasoning - PE
Text: The hiring process should be based on objective criteria without arbitrary adjustments based on professional associations, as such boosts make it unfair.
